sanskrit_verse:
सर्वतो धर्मषड्भागो राज्ञो भवति रक्षतः ।
अधर्मादपि षड्भागो भवत्यस्य ह्यरक्षतः ॥ ८.३०४॥
transliteration:
sarvato dharmasadbhāgo rājño bhavati rakṣataḥ |
adharādapi sadbhāgo bhavatyasya hyarakṣataḥ || 8.304||
sph_interpretive_translation: The King who protects Dharma embodies all six aspects of righteousness; the King who fails in protection inherits all six portions of unrighteousness.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority as capacity to uphold cosmic order
Capacity-based responsibility tied to role and power
Restoration logic rooted in alignment with Dharma
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler_upholds_dharma = TRUE THEN sovereignty_integrity = FULL
IF ruler_neglects_dharma = TRUE THEN systemic_corruption_index = INCREASED
IF governance_aligns_with_cosmic_order = FALSE THEN legitimacy_score = DEGRADED
IF consciousness_state_of_ruler > THRESHOLD THEN public_welfare_metric = OPTIMAL
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, a sovereign's failure to maintain Dharma incurs total liability for disorder arising therefrom. The threshold of responsibility is not intent but alignment—misalignment invokes full causal ownership.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that neglect of Dharma manifests sequentially as societal decay. Responsibility flows from capacity, not blame. Thus, correction lies in realigning consciousness, not inflicting punishment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Reestablish Dharma-adherence framework via guided introspection
Assign completion sequence for unrighteous outcomes
Restore integrity through voluntary assumption of systemic misalignment
Implement dharmic governance audit under awakened witness council
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, declared: Authority derives from alignment. Misalignment yields consequence, not punishment. Dharma prevails through conscious restoration. This law executes without exception.
